Articles.Content:
Laythe terrain is currently very uninteresting. The parts that aren't water are just shallow slopes and hills. I was thinking that it would be cool if laythe had rivers and mountains like kerbin. Laythe probably has a lot of tectonic activity which could create mountain ranges and water logged canyons. I feel like it could be incorporated well into 1.2 with the biome overhauls.

Edited September 29, 2016 by Vingo
Autocorrect
Rocks at least, instead of just mud, and dormant volcanos / cold lava flows. Perhaps the bits nearer the poles could resemble Iceland ( rocky ice with hotspots ).
It was already stated in last week's devnotes (or was it the week before?) that Laythe is getting a revamp, so it may be that the changes you're asking for have been implemented already.

The celestial bodies in general need a revamp. Kerbin is pretty good, but could do with some more features like volcanoes and river deltas.

In the real solar system, the Earth is not unique in its interesting and varied terrain. All of the planets and bodies (besides most asteroids maybe) have interesting geological and meteorological features. I think the bodies in the Kerbol system should be the same in that regard.
I actually really like the current Laythe, even though it's not very realistic.
